rule: All sensitive employee data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using AES-256 or equivalent standards.
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is mandatory for all remote access to company networks.
Passwords must be at least 12 characters long, containing uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters, and changed every 90 days.
Company devices must not be used for illegal activities, gambling, or accessing explicit content.
Employees working remotely must use the company-provided VPN for all business-related internet traffic.
All security incidents must be reported to the IT Security Team within 24 hours of discovery.
Employees are prohibited from installing unauthorized software on company devices without IT approval.
Customer data must be retained for a minimum of 5 years and then securely destroyed.
ID badges must be worn and visible at all times while on company premises.
Employees must not post confidential company information or trade secrets on social media platforms.
Automatic forwarding of company email to external personal email accounts is prohibited.
Sensitive documents and portable storage media must be locked away when the workspace is unattended.
All third-party vendors with access to company data must sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA).
All employees must complete annual cybersecurity awareness training.
Personal mobile devices used for work purposes must have a screen lock enabled and be enrolled in the MDM solution.
